availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James H. Schell (Allen County, Indiana, prosecutor)

body.p: Allen County, Indiana, attorney. Pennsylvania native. Son of Abram Schell and Jane Schell. Resident of Bedford County, Pennsylvania, in 1850. Attorney in Elkhart County, Indiana, in 1860. Prosecuting attorney in Allen County, Indiana, from 1862 to 1866.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Pennsylvania, Bedford County, Schellsburg, p. 38A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Indiana, Elkhart County, Elkhart, p. 420.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Indiana, Allen County, Fort Wayne Ward 2, p. 282A.
"The State," South Bend Daily Tribune (South Bend, Indiana), May 14, 1875, p. 2.
Thomas B. Helm, History of Allen County, Indiana, with Illustrations and Biographical Sketches of Some of Its Prominent Men and Pioneers (Chicago: Kingman Brothers, 1880), 87.
KYR-0001-006-0013
